document_data.name: ''Shield of Shielding''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Shields of shielding''''' were [[enchanted]] [[shield]]s that were imbued with protective magics.
document_data.Powers: A ''shield of shielding'' allowed the wielder to cast the ''[[shield (spell)|shield spell]]'' once per day.
document_data.History: It was believed that the ''shields of shielding'' were named in the style of [[Extremely Unimaginative Jimmy]], the man credited with creating the words of "waterfall" and "fireplace." During the [[Absolute crisis]] in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, a ''shield of shielding'' was among offerings made for the [[deity]] [[Helm]] at the [[Stormshore Tabernacle]] in [[Baldur's Gate]]. The magic item was sealed away in the temple's basement vault. Anyone daring enough to steal a ''shield of shielding'' would end up being cursed by the gods and attacked by Helm's servant [[deva]]s.
